title: Online hand gesture recognition using Continual Graph Transformers
author: Rim Slama (CESI LINEACT, UR 7527), Wael Rabah (CESI LINEACT), Hazem Wannous (IMT Nord Europe), ...
relevance_why: The proposed use of Transformer-based Graph Encoders for temporal feature extraction could inspire similar applications in audio data analysis, especially in capturing temporal dependencies.
background: Hand gesture recognition involves real-time classification of continuous sequences of movements made by the human hand, without pre-segmenting gestures.
contribution: This paper introduces a hybrid architecture combining Spatial Graph Convolutional Networks and Transformer-based Graph Encoder to enhance the recognition of online hand gestures, improving accuracy and reducing false positives.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous skeleton-based methods focused on segment-based recognition, which are not equipped for real-time applications and often suffer from a lack of temporal coherence.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates a continual learning mechanism into the architecture, improving adaptability to evolving data distributions in dynamic environments.

key_innovation: Employs a memory mechanism in the Transformer component to manage a continuous stream of feature vectors, enhancing real-time processing efficiency.
real_world_impact: The framework is applicable in crucial areas like human-robot collaboration, healthcare, and assistive technologies, promoting more natural interactions between humans and machines.
limitations: No explicit limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Spatial Graph Convolutional Networks: **Spatial Graph Convolutional Networks (S-GCN)** employ graph structural data to encapsulate relationships of elements in multi-dimensional spaces for spatial feature extraction.
new_terms.Transformer-based Graph Encoder: **Transformer-based Graph Encoder (TGE)** applies the self-attention mechanism of transformers to graph-structured data for capturing sequential dependencies.
